node.title: Teen who went clubbing after receiving positive COVID test moved into medi-hotel
node.alt: Police Commissioner Grant Stevens speaking into media microphones
node.description: SA Police areÂ working with SA Health as part of investigations into a young man who went clubbing after receiving a positive COVID-19 test, the Commissioner says. The teenager has now been moved into a medi-hotel.
node.content:
["A teenager who went clubbing in Adelaide after receiving a positive COVID-19 test has been moved into medi-hotel quarantine, SA's Chief Public Health Officer says.", "The 19-year-old man\u00a0received an SA Health text message notifying him that\u00a0he had tested positive on Friday evening.", "Despite the notification, he then\u00a0went to the Loverboy nightclub\u00a0on Hindley Street, which was later declared a close contact site.", "Chief Health Officer Nicola Spurrier told ABC Radio Adelaide that authorities \"are concerned about this young man, because we obviously have now got more entertainment [open] in the evenings\".", "\"I think most people do understand now that if you are a case, you keep away from other people because it's so important that we don't spread this disease around.\"", "Professor Spurrier said it was \"really important\" that if anyone tested positive, they stay home, stay away from other people and let close contacts know they were positive.", "", "
Professor Spurrier\u00a0said the young man was isolating in a medi-hotel.(ABC News: Lincoln Rothall)
", "The man is now in a city medi-hotel, Professor Spurrier said.", "\"Not everybody requires to be isolated in a hotel,\" she said.", "\"There are people that\u00a0we are concerned about that\u00a0are not isolating as we need them to be and then we have that ability to have them in a medi-hotel, and that's what happened in this situation.\"", "She said she did not know the reason for the man being tested in the first place.", "\"Obviously, if you've got symptoms, regardless of whether you've been tested or not, you shouldn't be out and about in the community,\" she said.", "\"If you're a close contact of somebody, you\u00a0should be in quarantine and that would be another reason for being\u00a0tested.", "
Prosecution evidence 'would come from SA Health'
", "Meanwhile, Police Commissioner Grant Stevens said if investigations lead to a court case, the man could face a fine of $20,000.", "\"Anybody who doesn't follow a direction under the emergency management act declaration does face an immediate fine of $1,000 or if the circumstance dictates that we take that person to court, there's a possible fine of $20,000.\"", "\"We will investigate and we will make a determination as to what action is necessary in the circumstances.\"", "Commissioner Stevens said police\u00a0would work with health authorities as part of the investigation.", "\"Part of the evidence that we would be looking for in relation to supporting any prosecution would come from SA Health,\" he said.", "\"We will work with SA Health, collect what evidence is available and make a decision on that basis.\"", "
SA Health adamant man didn't attend cricket
", "Professor Spurrier echoed\u00a0weekend health department statements acknowledging \"there was some talk about him also being at the cricket\" on Friday.", "\"The Adelaide Oval\u00a0also has extensive\u00a0CCTV footage \u2014\u00a0I've been up in their area where they do that observation.", "\"They\u00a0have an amazing ability to find people, and I think they have had a look and it doesn't appear that he has been at the cricket.\"", "Professor Spurrier\u00a0said contact tracers have used their \"standard process\" to get detailed information from the man about where he had been.", "\"We are streamlining our contact tracing, and we are focusing in our interviews on really our highest-risk areas,\" she said.", "Those areas include hospitals, aged care facilities and correctional services.", "\"This person will have been interviewed in a standard way to make sure\u00a0that we have picked up as many locations\u00a0as possible,\" she said.", "\"At the end of the day, when we are getting 80 plus\u00a0cases a day, we will be focusing on those higher-risk individuals and higher-risk places that they might have visited.\""]
